Jeff's place made up our quirkiest accommodations on a trip to Arizona and New Mexico. It's off the beaten path but there's some really pretty country nearby and it was a nice change of place from more crowded destinations, like Sedona.
The "Cowboy Cruiser" was more spacious than we expected, and the bed was eminently comfortable. The shower was fine, considering it's inside an RV.
The best part about staying here is Jeff himself. He's a good chef (we requested a vegetarian meal for dinner in addition to the usual breakfast) and we enjoyed talking with him very much as we ate and afterwards. It turns out he's married to a Polish woman from a city that my wife and I had visited and loved, so it was fun to hear about that.
So, if you want to be far from the madding crowd, with a great host and a quiet location and good food, Mountain Harmony just might be what you are looking for.

review_text: Great spot to land whether passing thru on a road trip, or taking a planned trip to see the myriad of majestic natural wonders that abound in this part of the country. There’s so much to see within driving distance of this place, you really should stay several days or longer if possible. And make sure you take them up on the offer for dinner (a small charge and totally worth it!) or any other meal besides the included breakfast, because the food they make is certainly on par with a nice restaurant’s quality, if not gourmet. I had the best soup of my life there! And everything was masterfully done, none of it overly fancy or seasoned, just inspired straightforward and delicious real ingredients with love. Plus they can suit it to any taste, although I strongly recommend you go with chef’s choice (otherwise it’s like only handing Picasso two or three colors of paint.. ya know?!). Nothing beats a homemade meal done right, which they certainly do. Plus there ain’t much else around if anything at all to choose from anyways, so they actually could be serving lower quality food and get away with it, but they would never do that - they are really good people who want to treat others right and well, and they do. Even if there are other choices around, I would stay right here every time. The place was so peaceful and serene, such a good vibe and welcoming feeling from the hosts, that honestly it took me a little longer to leave than I intended! You may well get that feeling too, at least a little bit, like you don’t want to leave: this place not only refreshes your energy better than a hotel stay would, but I swear even your soul can get a refresh here if you allow it to. The property, the place, and the access to so many ways to spectacularly connect to nature are all big parts of what makes this a great experience.. then add to that the great hosts and that’s what puts it over the top as such a special stay. This is the place you go stay for 5-7 days to totally get away and come out of it feeling completely refreshed and renewed and reconnected to yourself and what really matters. But it is also perfect for someone passing thru for the night, far better than a hotel - there’s no comparison. It’s a great RV with everything you need and more, and very private. Mind that you are not going to get an unlimited amount of hot water in the shower at one time, but you can get a good one if you don’t dally. As a tall person, the shower head was even with mine, but it is the removable style with a hose so no problem. I was so fulfilled by the day of touring around, the fabulous dinner, the great company, the infinite stars you see at night and the sweet clean air that I didn’t even want to turn on the TV when I retired to my quarters. I just enjoyed how peaceful and still it all was, that I had no walls shared with others, how great it felt to be where the hosts were so kind and caring and available yet will gladly leave you to yourself if that’s what you want.. that I just sat there for awhile appreciating what seemed like one of the few spots left in the world where things are not rushed nor constantly demanding. Then I did some reading and writing before passing out and sleeping wonderfully. The outside air can cool down a lot at night which makes for great slumber, but there is a heater available if needed that works fine to warm the unit. I decided to turn it off and just got under the big comforter and slept like a log. After a few days on the road in thankless slacking overpriced hotels that seemingly drained more energy than they replenished, this was the splendid respite I sorely needed to refresh my body and spirit. Like I said, the hosts being that perfect balance of happily there to make your stay the best it can be, yet at the same time they aren’t prying or spying or micro-managing you like some other hosts can do. After a meal at the really cool main house that looks like a former bar/restaurant inside on the first floor and has a beautiful mural and awesome artwork displayed, you can sit outside on the covered or uncovered portion of the decks and chat with others, walk up one flight of stairs to the upper porch and see the dormant volcanoes on the nearby horizon then catch a glorious sunset above majestic reefs right there, or you can head on back to your space or on your way with no issue at all. I was able to totally relax and unwind there like you cannot really do at most places. Very grateful, much love. P.S. the GPS can have you several miles off from this place so follow the host’s short easy directions to find the place at the end

We hoped that my husband could return, but our son endured a 9-hour surgery and went to ICU. My husband was prepared to go from ABQ to Grants to honor the check-out instructions. I reached out to Michael and explained the situation requesting the instructions to vacate. Michael was wonderful and so very understanding and said not to worry about it. The home was exactly as pictured, nestled in a mountainous valley with very few neighbors, just 6 or so miles outside Grants. We felt as if we were on our own out there. Everything we need was there. We appreciated cooking for ourselves, having our two pups with us, and watching La Vuelta at night. The home was meticulously clean and the premises were neat and taken care of. He always responded within minutes. We are so grateful to come back to this valley!

The McCrae Cabin is is a masterpiece of old world craftsmanship, from the panned windows that let in sunlight in the winter (and the breeze during hot months) to the built-in cabinets to the flawless dowelled hardwood floor. Seriously, if you're a carpenter or a woodworker, come for a night just to check out the living room floor.
The hot tub was hot and easy to use, and the view from it was peaceful. There were a dozen different birds at the well-stocked feeders, red-wing blackbirds, scrub jays, even a Lewis's Woodpecker, a spectacular bird I'd never seen before. The books Bruce left out gave some great context for the area and were perfect for a weekend read.
Bruce's acreage was secluded enough for privacy, but at the end of the road in a charming community where neighbors were close enough (and friendly enough) that we didn't feel completely isolated either--perfect in case of trouble.
Photos don't do this place justice. Bruce was a great host. If you're on the fence, book it.

Bath: hot water for showering; counter space
Bedroom: peaceful; touch-lighting; lots of storage
Kitchen: well-stocked; gourmet goodies & spices; large fridge/freezer; gas stove/oven; microwave; coffee maker & grinder
Laundry: downstairs, didn't use
Living: gorgeous floors & woodwork; tasteful decor; fireplace; comfy furniture; carpet-free (YAY!); lots of books, magazines, & decor relevant to New Mexico
Outdoors: Decks! hot tub for stargazing; lake view from house & nearby platform deck; LOTS of birds at feeders; quiet, forested street for walking
Tech: strong Verizon signal in the cabin for calls and internet
We plan to return!

The cabin itself is at high elevation (over 7000’) so the climate is more like Flagstaff than Gallup, surrounded by pine trees and cool breezes. The cabin itself is cozy and spotlessly clean, filled with thoughtful touches - food, books, binoculars, games, firewood etc. The cell reception is very good (Verizon), so no Wi-Fi necessary. The nearby lake isn’t at it’s highest level these days, but adds to the lovely view still. We used the cabin as a base camp for exploring the Zuni mountains and day trips in the four corners region. We could have spent many more days and not run out of fun adventures. Not everything in the Zuni range is well documented, so local advice and a sense of adventure is helpful. Zero crowds, a huge plus for us.
